I was born in Russia and for the last 7 years I live in Buenos Aires. I’m interested in a career in IT because I find it challenging and interesting. Android developing and the best practices in POO are my main focuses. I’ve finished several programming courses (Java, Python, web design full stack, Android Apps development with Kotlin), I continue studying on my own and I’m developing applications for learning purposes.
 
Some technologies which I use:
- Kotlin, Java, Android SDK
- Data binding, MVVM and LiveData
- Navigation
- RecyclerView and ViewPager2
- Retrofit (data fetching from the Internet)
- Room (SQL database library for Android)
- Fused location provider (GPS)
- etc.
I have also worked with Python, JavaScript, C++ (Arduino), React, Bootstrap, Node JS, React Native.
 
I speak and write in Russian, Spanish, English, Portuguese languages.
I worked as a graphic designer and a photographer, I organized a tango school in Russia and Argentina.
I’m responsible, communicable, creative, autodidact, a good leader.

I’m just starting my IT career. During my life I was a graphic designer and photographer, I had a tango school in Russia and various tango projects in Argentina. Currently I work as refrigeration technician by myself. \n\nMy programmer skills are shown in this app, I tried to implement here the most important technologies, the source code is on my GitHub page: yupanov.

This part of the app complements the resume, it’s a demo of my skills. What happens here:
- Fetching the location data using GPS (Fused location provider, Android permissions)
- Requiring the data from openweathermap.org and receiving it as JSON (Retrofit2)
- Converting the data to the Kotlin objects (Moshi)
- Showing data on the screen (MVVM, Live data, Data binding)
